results.title: Matrix metalloproteinase inhibition reduces oxidative stress associated with cerebral amyloid angiopathy in vivo in transgenic mice.
results.text_hl: Conversely, a selection of agents that inhibit MMP by different mechanisms of action, including @CHEMICAL_Minocycline @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008911 @@@minocycline@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_GM_6001 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C078131 @@@GM6001@@@, reduced not only @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Amyloid_Angiopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016657 @@@CAA@@@-associated MMP activation (approximately 30-40% reduction) but also oxidative stress (approximately 40% reduction).

citations.NLM: Garcia-Alloza M, Prada C, Lattarulo C, Fine S, Borrelli LA, Betensky R, Greenberg SM, Frosch MP, Bacskai BJ. Matrix metalloproteinase inhibition reduces oxidative stress associated with cerebral amyloid angiopathy in vivo in transgenic mice. J Neurochem. 2009 Jun;109(6):1636-47. PMID: 19457117
